translated: The Elder’s Birth Stories🔽. The Chapter with the Flower of the Golden Shower Tree
The Elder Koraṇḍapuppha’s Birth Story
“In the past I was a woodcutter,🔽and I lived by hunting with my father and mother.

analyzed: pitu mātu matena aha  pasumārena jīvāmi
translated: I did not have any skill,
and I did not have any merit.
Near my dwelling place
the three-stepped one, the leader of the world,
the one with eyes of compassion,🔽showed me three steps.
When I saw the steps
of the Teacher named Tissa,
with a mind full of joy,
I developed faith in the steps.
When I saw the flowering golden shower tree,
the tree that grows on the earth,
I took a handful of flowers
and worshipped the best of steps.
By that good deed well done,
by my intention and aspiration,
having given up my human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.

analyzed: yam yam yonupapajjāmi  devattam atha mānusa
translated: Wherever I was reborn,🔽whether as a god or a human,
I had the golden shower tree’s bark,
and I was very radiant.
For twenty-two eons,
ever since I did that deed,
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the steps.
I have burned up the defilements,
I live without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was for me
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.
